byline.contributor: Julfikar Ali Manik reported from Dhaka, and Ellen Barry from New Delhi.
byline.original: By JULFIKAR ALI MANIK and ELLEN BARRY

abstract: Two gunman kill Japanese man Kunio Hoshi in Bangladesh and Islamic State claims responsibility; attack is second in less than week in country, as group said they also killed Cesare Tavella, Italian aid worker.
lead_paragraph: A Japanese man was shot by two unidentified gunmen less than a week after a similar killing of an Italian aid worker in the Bangladeshi capital was claimed by the Islamic State.

headline.main: In Bangladesh, a Second Foreigner Is Violently Killed
headline.print_headline: Suspected Extremists Kill 2nd Foreigner in Bangladesh

snippet: A Japanese man was shot by two unidentified gunmen less than a week after a similar killing of an Italian aid worker in the Bangladeshi capital was claimed by the Islamic State.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
